channel.title: Posts on Daniel Swan
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Daniel Swan

item.title: The difference between by_slice() and do()
item.description: In my last post I talked about the calculator I had just built that needed to apply a linear model in a batch fashion to a provided dataset. In the context of single-case design, the model is applied to a single individual’s behaviors across time. What ended up in that calculator looked (kind of) like this: dat %>% slice_rows(clusters) %>% by_slice(~model_params(dat = ., .collate = "cols") Here, clusters is just the user-supplied set of variables that uniquely describe one individual’s data–say a study ID and a participant ID.

item.title: This blog
item.description: What I’ve learned in my time as a Ph.D. student is that I enjoy is facilitating other people’s work and research. I love writing R code that helps other people succeed, be it code that’s necessary to get something working for a project of my adviser’s, the code to build a function or a shiny app to make statistical methods available to researchers, or code to help someone with understanding, transforming, or analyzing their data.
